intro: Cucurbita okeechobeensis subsp. okeechobeensis, commonly known as the Okeechobee gourd, is a rare and endangered species native to the Everglades of Florida. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, characterized by its trailing growth habit and large, lobed leaves. The plant produces distinctive, elongated fruits with a smooth, warty surface and a pale green to yellowish color. It typically flowers in late summer and early fall, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. This subspecies is adapted to wetland environments and plays a unique role in the ecological diversity of the region.
